text: Gita Govinda was written by the 12th-century Hindu poet Jaydev. It describes the relationship between Krishna and the female cow herders of Vrindavan. The Gita Govinda is organized into twelve chapters. Each chapter is further sub- divided into twenty-four divisions called Prabandhas. The poem has been translated into most modern Indian languages and many European languages. ==References== Category:Hindu texts Category:12th-century poems
title: Gita Govinda
